I wanted to follow up on the following Pennsylvania Right to Know Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Nov. 15, 2022. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: [External] RE: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Pennsylvania State Employees (2019 - 2022)
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Goehring:

On November 15, 2022, the open-records officer of the Governor's Office of Administration (OA) received your written request for information.  Under the Right-To-Know Law, a written response to your request is due on or before November 22, 2022.

Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: [External] Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Pennsylvania State Employees (2019 - 2022) - OA RTKL Request: 2022.086
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Goehring:

On November 15, 2022, the open-records officer of the Governor's Office of Administration (OA) received your written request for information.  OA is responding to your requests under the Pennsylvania's Right-To-Know Law (RTKL), Act of February 14, 2008, P.L. 6, as amended, 65 P.S. §§ 67.101-67.3104.  Under the RTKL, a written response to your request is due on or before November 22, 2022.

This is an interim response, not a final response, to your request.  Under the provisions of 65 P.S. § 67.902(b)(2), you are hereby notified that your request is being reviewed for the reason(s) listed below and OA will require up to an additional 30 days, i.e., until December 22, 2022, in which to respond to your request.

·  Compliance with your request may require the redaction of certain information that is not subject to access under RTKL.

·  Your request is under legal review to determine whether a requested record is a "public record" for purposes of the RTKL.

·  The extent or nature of the request precludes a response within the required time period.

Finally, the estimated or actual total for any fees that may be owed when the record becomes available will be included in our subsequent response.  Prepayment is required before providing access when the estimated cost to fulfill each request exceeds $100.00.  65 P.S. § 67.1307(h).  If you have any questions regarding this letter, please contact me.

Sincerely,



Wha Lee Strohecker
Agency Open Records Officer
Governor's Office of Administration
510 Finance Building
Harrisburg, Pennsylvania 17120

communications.subject: RE: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Pennsylvania State Employees (2019 - 2022)
communications.communication:
Sounds great -- thank you!

Best,
Ben

communications.subject: RE: [External] RE: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Pennsylvania State Employees (2019 - 2022), OA RTKL Request: 2022.086, final response
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Goehring:

"On November 15, 2022, the open-records officer of the Governor’s Office of Administration (OA) received your written request for information.  OA is responding to your request under Pennsylvania’s Right-To-Know Law (RTKL), Act of February 14, 2008, P.L. 6, as amended, 65 P.S. §§ 67.101-67.3104.  Under the RTKL, a written response to your request was due on or before November 22, 2022.  On November 22, 2022, I wrote to you indicating OA required an additional thirty (30) days to provide a response.  This is OA’s final response. 

You requested:

Monthly electronic listings of all employees of the Pennsylvania Executive Branch from January 1, 2019 to July 31, 2022. Specifically,…electronic listings of all individuals employed within all state agencies, commissions, and departments for each month from January 1, 2019 to July 31, 2022…with the following fields for each employee: full legal name, unique employee identification code, date of birth or age, title, department or agency, race, gender, full-time/part-time status, location, hire date, termination date, civil service status, and gross annual salary.

 

Your request is attached.  Your request is granted in part and denied in part. You can access the responsive records through the following link:   CWOPA Emps by Quarter 2019-2022.xlsx The spreadsheet has tabs in quarterly intervals containing the public data points you requested for employees under the Governor’s jurisdiction, with the exception of those employees whose information is exempt in whole or in part for security reasons and as set forth in more detail below.  This link will only be available for a period of thirty days after December 21, 2022, after which you will no longer have access to the link.  In addition, please note, all employee work locations are reflected through the headquarter addresses for the agency.

 

Your request is denied in part due to several requested items being exempt from disclosure under the RTKL.  The portion of your request seeking employees’ date of birth, age, gender, race and middle names are denied pursuant to the Pennsylvania constitutional right to privacy.  See Rusty Brown and the Freedom Foundation v. Pennsylvania Office of Administration, OOR Dkt. No.: AP 2021-1707 (finding that birth years and middle names were exempt from disclosure pursuant to the Pennsylvania constitutional right to privacy).

 

In addition, several employees’ information is exempt, either in whole or in part, from disclosure due to the following exemptions:

 

Section 708(b)(1)(ii), which exempts disclosure if disclosing the information “would be reasonably likely to result in a substantial and demonstrable risk of physical harm to or the personal security of an individual.”  65 P.S. § 67.708(b)(1)(ii);
 

Section 708(b)(2), which exempts disclosure if disclosure of the information jeopardizes or threatens public safety or preparedness or public protection activity and the information is maintained in connection with the military, homeland security, national defense, law enforcement or other public safety activity.   65 P.S. § 67.708(b)(2);
 

Section 708(b)(3), which exempts disclosure if disclosure of the information “creates a reasonable likelihood of endangering the safety or the physical security of a building, public utility resources, infrastructure, facility or information storage system….” 65 P.S. § 67.708(b)(3); and
 

Section 708(b)(6)(iii), which exempts from disclosure “the name or other identifying information relating to an individual performing an undercover or covert law enforcement activity.”  65 P.S. § 67.708(b)(6)(iii).  
 

You have a right to appeal the denial of access to records. Any appeal to this response must be made in writing to the Office of Open Records (OOR), 333 Market Street, 16th Floor, Harrisburg, PA 17101-2234.  If you choose to file an appeal, you must do so within 15 business days of the mailing date of this response and send to the OOR:

 

This response;
Your request; and
The reason why you think the record exists under the custody or control of the agency.
 

Also, the OOR has an appeal form available on its website at: http://www.openrecords.pa.gov/Appeals/AppealForm.cfm.

 

Sincerely,

 

 

 

Wha Lee Strohecker

Agency Open Records Officer

Governor’s Office of Administration

510 Finance Building

613 North Street

Harrisburg, Pennsylvania 17120

717.783.5055

RA-RTKOA@pa.gov"

communications.subject: RE: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Pennsylvania State Employees (2019 - 2022)
communications.communication:
Hi Wha, 

Thank you for sending these along! I have one quick follow up question. Is the "Hire Date" variable the date in which someone was originally hired by the state or is it the date someone was hired for their current position? If it is the former, does it change if someone leaves the state and then returns at a later date? 

Thank you!

Best,
Ben

communications.subject: FW: Received from 14582003365 - Follow-up question 2022.086
communications.communication:
Mr. Goehring,
The "Hire Date" is not a variable date and is the date in which a person originally began employment with the Commonwealth. Even if there is a break in employment, the "Hire Date" remains the same. Please note, that for a small number of employees the "Hire Date" does not contain a value so the current date of service was used as the "Hire Date".

Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Pennsylvania State Employees (2019 - 2022)
communications.communication:
Great -- thank you!

Ben

Mike Miller

communications.subject: Re: Florida Sunshine Law Request: FEC Complaints
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Miller,

In response to your request for public records, I have determined that we
have 21 public record complaints responsive to your request (filed between
July 1, 2022 and December 23, 2022.  Please note that this number reflects
only the complaints that are public record and do not include any that
remain confidential, and or appeals of automatic fines cases (appeals are
filed by candidates and or committees for late filed reports).    A
confidential complaint becomes public record after a probable cause
determination.  See s. 106.25(7), F.S.

Before I can release the records, I am required to review the documents and
apply required redactions to any confidential and exempt information that
may be included in the complaints.  I will notify you the number of pages
and any costs involved, if any, prior to completion of the request.
Regards,

Donna Ann Malphurs
Agency Clerk/Public Information Officer

communications.subject: Re: Florida Sunshine Law Request: FEC Complaints -- Batch 1 of 3
communications.communication:
The review of the complaints is completed.  There are approximately 200
pages involved in the compilation of public complaints filed between July
1, 2022 through December 23, 2022.   Since it did not take too long to
review and redact, I am not charging you for these documents.  However, I
will have to submit them to you in increments in order to pass the fire
wall limitation.

If you have any questions, please let me know.

Regards,

Donna Ann Malphurs
Agency Clerk/Public Information Officer

title: Written Correspondence Regarding The VCOEB Federal Asvosory Committee (05/01/2022 - Present) (Department of Veterans Affairs, Veterans Health Administration)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all written communications (including but not limited to emails) which were created, written, distributed, facsimiled and / or electronically transmitted between the dates of May 1st 2022 and one day before Responsive documents are provided to me in Response to this Request - regarding, whether directly or indirectly, the Veterans and Community Oversight and Engagement Board Federal Advisory Committee (aka VCOEB); wherein any one or more of the following persons are recipients, senders and / or distributors of said written correspondence:

Denis McDonough, Secretary of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs

Steven Braverman, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System Medical Center Director)

Robert Merchant, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System Executive Director)

Chihung Szeto, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Veterans Experience Office (often referred to as a VCOEB Federal Advisory Committee Administrator)

Eugene W. Skinner, U.S. Department
of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Defense Consultant, Federal Acquisitions Expert & Federal Advisory Committee Administrator)

Keith Harris, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Senior Executive Homelessness Agent for Greater Los Angeles)

Alan Trinh, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Contract Officer and Deputy Director)

Michael J. Missal, Inspector General of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs

Michael W. Fisher, an executive with the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Network Director of VISN 22)

Matthew MacGahran, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Chief of Community Engagement And Re-Integration Services)

Brett Simms, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as an Executive Director of the Office Of Asset Enterprise Management)

Jon J. Rychalski, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as the Chief Financial Officer of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs *even though he appears to have no Certified Public Account License)

Any and all U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Police Officers working at the West Los Angeles VA Soldiers Home aka VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System West Los Angeles VA Medical Center

I am technically qualified as a journalist.  My work is performed on an independent, unpaid volunteer basis.  This specific Request regarding recent written correspondence Records involving approximately 15 specified Public Officials within the specified period, pertaining to a Federal Advisory Committee Legislated under Public Law 114-226 and Chartered to "improve outcomes for homeless Veterans" is not made nor intended to be used for commercial purposes.  It does regard, among other things: a Public Service, Public Meetings, Open Sessions and matters related to a Federal Advisory Committee.

Additional background information regarding the VCOEB is provided to interested parties at the following links for educational and contextually informative purposes which may offer significant insights in support of the Lawful operation of Federal Advisory Committees operating in Our Nation's Capital of Veteran Homelessness:

https://www.instagram.com/reel/CiPiS97jIid/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

https://www.instagram.com/reel/ChqrwoNDt4H/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

https://www.instagram.com/p/CfKWzSev017/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

https://www.instagram.com/p/CiGkVwmvw3M/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

https://www.instagram.com/reel/Chr39g_j7qG/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

https://www.instagram.com/tv/CU-MvrhDuAI/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ryan Thompson

communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Thompson,


This letter acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) dated October 5, 2022, in which you requested:


  *   Copies of all written communications (including but not limited to emails) which were created, written, distributed, facsimiled and / or electronically transmitted between the dates of May 1, 2022, and one day before Responsive documents are provided to me in Response to this Request - regarding, whether directly or indirectly, the Veterans and Community Oversight and Engagement Board Federal Advisory Committee (aka VCOEB); wherein any one or more of the following persons are recipients, senders and / or distributors of said written correspondence:



  *   Denis McDonough, Secretary of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs
  *   Steven Braverman, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System Medical Center Director)
  *   Robert Merchant, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System Executive Director)
  *   Chihung Szeto, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Veterans Experience Office (often referred to as a VCOEB Federal Advisory Committee Administrator)
  *   Eugene W. Skinner, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Defense Consultant, Federal Acquisitions Expert & Federal Advisory Committee Administrator)
  *   Keith Harris, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Senior Executive Homelessness Agent for Greater Los Angeles)
  *   Alan Trinh, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Contract Officer and Deputy Director)
  *   Michael J. Missal, Inspector General of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs
  *   Michael W. Fisher, an executive with the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Network Director of VISN 22)
  *   Matthew MacGahran, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as a Chief of Community Engagement and Re-Integration Services)
  *   Brett Simms, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as an Executive Director of the Office of Asset Enterprise Management)
  *   Jon J. Rychalski, U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (often referred to as the Chief Financial Officer of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs *even though he appears to have no Certified Public Account License)



  *   Any and all U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Police Officers working at the West Los Angeles VA Soldiers Home aka VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System West Los Angeles VA Medical Center




The FOIA Service received your request on October 18, 2022, and assigned it FOIA tracking numbers 23-00135-F; 23-00499-F; 23-00566-F; 23-00567-F; 23-00568-F; 23-00569-F; and 23-00570-F.  Please refer to these numbers when communicating with the VA about this request.


The records you requested, if they exist, are maintained at the Office of the Secretary (OSVA); Office of Assistant Secretary for Management (MGMT); Veterans Experience Office (VEO); Office of Asset Enterprise Management (OAEM); VISN 22 - Desert Pacific Health Care Network (HCN); Veterans Health Administration (VHA), VA Greater Los Angeles Health Care System (HCS) and the Office of Inspection General (OIG).  Therefore, we are redirecting your request to these offices for a file search and a direct response to you. OIG has its own tracking number.  You will be notified by them of its FOIA tracking number.  If you wish to know the status of your request, please contact them directly at the following addresses:

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Written Correspondence Regarding The VCOEB Federal Asvosory Committee (05/01/2022 - Present) (Department of Veterans Affairs, Veterans Health Administration)
communications.communication:
Veterans Health Administration:

Please review the attached and urgent folowup and response to your improper attempt to close this Request without satisfactory Response.  The attached file is named RT-VHA_FOIA_11222022_R1.pdf

For your and the Public's convenience, text of the body of the attached Letter portion of the aforementioned, urgent followup - follows below.  Note the attachement must be reviewed to review the cited Appendices.

____________________________________________________________________

November 22nd, 2022


TO:

U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs
Veterans Health Administration
Office of the Inspector General
Washington DC, USA


CC:

Denis McDonough, Secretary of the U.S Department of Veterans Affairs
Michael J. Missal, Inspector General of the U.S Department of Veterans Affairs
Luis-Vasquez Contes, American GI Forum National Commander
Lawrence Romo, American GI Forum National Legislative Director
Esau Herrera, American GI Forum CA State Commander
Francisco Juarez, American GI Forum El Camino Real Chapter Legislative Officer 
Richard Southern, Vietnam Veterans of America National Board Member
Sennet Devermont, Always For The People
Cable News Network
Mirror Media Group
Muckrock News


RE:

Followup on 10/05/0222 US DVA VHA FOIA Request (Ryan Thompson)
US DVA FOIA Tracking Numbers include: 23-00135-F, 23-00499-F, 23-00566-F,
23-00567-F, 23-00568-F, 23-00569-F, 23-00570-F & 23-00006-FOIA


VIA:  Muckrock News & E-Mail


U.S Department of Veterans Affairs VHA, OIG & Related FOIA Staff:


On 10/05/2022, I submitted an FOIA Request to the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Veterans Health Administration; regarding copies of written communications by, as well as received by; specified U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Officials between 05/01/2022 and Present - about the Veterans And Community Oversight And Engagement Board (VCOEB) Federal Advisory Committee that's Chartered under the Federal Advisory Committee Act, Mandated by Public Law 114-226 as well as regulated by the Administrative Procedures Act.  A copy of the Request is attached to this Letter as "Appendix A".

On 10/20/2022, the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Veterans Health Administration (VHA) Acknowledged receiving my FOIA Request on 10/18/2022 and reported the following Tracking Numbers for it: 23-00135-F, 23-00499-F, 23-00566-F, 23-00567-F, 23-00568-F, 23-00569-F, 23-00570-F.  Veterans Health Administration stated in that Acknowledgement that the Requested Records, if they exist, will be maintained by Veterans Health Administration; as well as other divisions of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs, including the VA Office of the Inspector General, all of which VHA is coordinating with to satisfy the Request.  A copy of VHA's 10/20/2022 Acknowledgement is attached to this Letter within "Appendix A".

On 11/17/2022, I received an "Agency Final Response" to my FOIA Request from Government Information Specialist Barya Offer, on behalf of the Office of the Inspector General for the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs.  The sum of Offer's purported "Agency Final Response" is, "please see the Agency Final Response regarding your request"; with an attached PDF file named "Agency Final Response No Records - Full Denial.pdf".  Said file is a letter from Supervisory Government Information Specialist Ruthhee G. Bellamy of the VA OIG Release Information Office - notifying me that VA OIG assigned Tracking Number 23-00006-FOIA to my Request, among other things.  A copy of VHA's 11/17/2022 "Agency Final Response" is included in the "Appendix A" attachment to this Letter.

The "Agency Final Response No Records - Full Denial" letter from VA OIG on 11/17/2022 is attached to this Letter as "Appendix B"; and declares "we were unable to locate any responsive records pertaining to your request"; yet only as the Request pertains to Inspector General Michael J. Missal in VA OIG Records.  Unfortunately, VA OIG's Response to my Request is a false statement of fact; provable by one of many Records in my possession which would have to be included in any satisfactory Response to my Request, notwithstanding whether that Response is from VA OIG, VHA or otherwise applicable officse / divisions of US DVA.

The aforementioned Record in my possession is an e-mail I sent to Inspector General Missal and others on 05/27/2022 regarding VCOEB, that a simple search for the text "VCOEB" will produce upon querying Inspector General Missal's e-mail correspondence between 05/01/2022 and Present.  Given that e-mail was not returned to sender and Inspector General Missal directly corresponded with me several times in the recent past from the same e-mail address; and because information about a Federal Advisory Committee that holds Public Meetings in Open Session on Public land for Public attendance (as Publicly Noticed in the Federal Register), is not qualified to be suppressed due limited National Security provisions under 5 U.S.C. Statutes governing FOIA - apparently the minimum effort to satisfactorily Respond to my Request is beyond some U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Officials' intent to perform...  Despite VA OIG's purported "Agency Final Response No Records - Full Denial" Letter probably cost Federal Taxpayer's far more to produce than performing the simple searches to lawfully satisfy and Respond to my Request will; presuming Public Records required to satisfy my Request were not unlawfully tampered with. Even in that hypothetical scenario though, the Records are obtainable from one of many archives US DVA is Mandated to retain as National Security against the tampering or loss of such Records.  A copy of my aforementioned 05/27/2022 e-mail to Inspector General Missal and one of many e-mails Inspector General Missal sent me from the same address he received my 05/27/2020 e-mail at, are attached to this Letter as "Appendix C".
Notwithstanding the validity or lack thereof in VA OIG's Response to a portion of my Request through VHA, the partial Response is not a legitimate, full Response to my Request; despite it being uncannily misrepresented as such by false statements of fact.

The Agency is at least procedurally failing to Respond to my Request on time in accordance with Federal Public Law.  I reassure you the Requested Records regarding a Federal Advisory Committee with a Public Law Mandate and Charter to improve outcomes for Veterans via Public Meetings held in Open Session here in Our Nation's Capital of Veteran Homelessness - are delays of Public Records offering a direct positive impact on disabled homeless Veterans' probability of survival and General Welfare of U.S. Taxpayers  Contrarily, the ongoing and baseless delays Responding to my Request are negatively impacting disabled homeless Veterans and Federal Taxpayers, until and unless the Request is fully and legitimately Responded to.

Given my maintained Good Faith in the majority of Our U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Staff's Public Integrity and capacity to ethically perform their duties in accordance with the Department's true Mission - I expect nothing less than the People of the United States of America do in this matter; a swift, comprehensive, accurate and satisfactory Response to my Request in accordance with Our Rights, Public Laws and increasing expenditures to expect no less of Our U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs' performance in respect thereof.

I declare under under penalty of perjury that the foregoing is true and correct.  Executed on November 22nd, 2022 in Los Angeles, California by:



Ryan Thompson


Independent Volunteer Civil Rights Advocate & Reporter
Member, American GI Forum Congressionally Chartered VSO
NHDVS.net
rt@nhdvs.net

C/o Muckrock News
DEPT MR 103928
263 Huntington Avenue
Boston, MA 02115

title: Copies Of All Annual Reports Submitted In Accordance With Public Law 114-226 (Department of Veterans Affairs, Office of Inspector General)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Copies Of All Annual Reports Submitted In Accordance With Public Law 114-226 (Department of Veterans Affairs, Office of Inspector General)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all Annual Reports for the years 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021 & 2022 which the Secretary of The U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs is Mandated to Submit in accordance with Public Law 114-226 As Amended.  Applicable excerpts of Public Law 114-226 As Amended are provided below for your convenient reference in processing this Request within the Mandated time to Respond in Accordance with Public Law.

Public Law 114-226 As Amended, Section 2(j):

(2) ANNUAL REPORT.—Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this Act, and not less frequently than annually thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to the Committees on Veterans’ Affairs of the Senate and House of Representatives, the Committees on Appropriations of the Senate and House of Representatives, and each Member of the Senate and the House of Representatives who represents the area in which the Campus is located an annual report evaluating all leases and land-sharing agreements carried out at the Campus, including- (A) an evaluation of the management of the revenue generated by the leases; and (B) the records described in subsection (b)(3)(D).


Public Law 114-226 As Amended, Section 2(b)(3)(D):

(3) A lease of real property for a term not to exceed 10 years to The Regents of the University of California, a corporation organized under the laws of the State of California, on behalf of its University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) campus (hereinafter in this section referred to as ‘‘The Regents’’), if—

(D) The Regents maintains records documenting the value of the additional services and support that The Regents provides pursuant to subparagraph (C) for the duration of the lease and makes such records available to the Secretary.

Public Law 114-226 As Amended, Section 2(b)(3)(C):

(C) The Regents expressly agrees to provide, during the term of the lease and to an extent and in a manner that the Secretary considers appropriate, additional services and support (for which The Regents is not compensated by the Secretary or through an existing medical affiliation agreement) that—

(i) principally benefit veterans and their families, including veterans that are severely disabled, women, aging, or homeless; and

(ii) may consist of activities relating to the medical, clinical, therapeutic, dietary, rehabilitative, legal, mental, spiritual, physical, recreational, research, and counseling needs of veterans and their families or any of the purposes specified in any of subparagraphs (A) through (I) of paragraph (2)

Public Law 114-226 As Amended, Section 2(b)(2):

(2) Any lease of real property for a term not to exceed 50 years to a third party to provide services that principally benefit veterans and their families and that are limited to one or more of the following purposes:

(A) The promotion of health and wellness, including nutrition and spiritual wellness.
(B) Education.
(C) Vocational training, skills building, or other training related to employment.
(D) Peer activities, socialization, or physical recreation.
(E) Assistance with legal issues and Federal benefits.
(F) Volunteerism.
(G) Family support services, including child care.
(H) Transportation.
(I) Services in support of one or more of the purposes specified in subparagraphs (A) through (H).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ryan Thompson

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: FDLE database information request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1.) A copy of all emails received by FDLE at email address:  TARRequest@fdle.state.fl.us and/or DAVIDsupport@fdle.state.fl.us from any email address with a domain ending in the following: @sheriffleefl.org, @pascosheriff.org, @hcso.tampa.fl.us, @tampagov.net. 
2.) A copy of all replies to the emails requested above, including any attachments. 
Please limit this request to records created or received beginning Jan 1, 2022 and ending the date of this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Jeff Collins

communications.subject: FDLE Office of General Counsel
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting the Florida Department of Law Enforcement Office of General Counsel. This message is being provided as confirmation your message was received. You should receive a response to your inquiry as soon as possible.


If you need criminal history records, please visit our website, https://www.fdle.state.fl.us/Criminal-History-Records/Obtaining-Criminal-History-Information.aspx, and/or contact FDLE’s Criminal History Services Section at ApplicantChecks@fdle.state.fl.us<mailto:ApplicantChecks@fdle.state.fl.us> or (850) 410-8161.

Public records requests are processed in the order that they are received. Processing time may be lengthened due to the nature and extent of the request. Searches may be negative and FDLE may not have records responsive to your public records request. You may also receive an invoice for your request depending on the nature and extent of your public records request. Please feel free to contact us at (850) 410-7676, or publicrecords@fdle.state.fl.us, if you have additional specific information relating to the records you are requesting, as this may help expedite your request and/or reduce costs that may be associated with the request.

Additional information regarding how to obtain public records including what costs may be applicable is contained from the hyperlink below. We are committed to our fundamental values of Service, Integrity, Respect, and Quality.

For Additional Information click http://www.fdle.state.fl.us/OGC/Public-Records.aspx<https://www.fdle.state.fl.us/OGC/Public-Records.aspx>

communications.subject: FW: Public Records Request Confirmation Receipt, FDLE Docket No. PRR-2022-1746
communications.communication:
Dear Jeff Collins:

RE:      Public Records Request Confirmation Receipt, FDLE Docket No. PRR-2022-1746

This email serves to confirm receipt of your public records request for a transaction archive report (TAR). If you need criminal history records, please visit our website, http://www.fdle.state.fl.us/Criminal-History-Records/Obtaining-Criminal-History-Information.aspx, and/or contact FDLE's Criminal History Services Section at ApplicantChecks@fdle.state.fl.us<mailto:ApplicantChecks@fdle.state.fl.us> or (850) 410-8161.

Public records requests are processed in the order that they are received. Processing time may be lengthy due to the nature and extent of the request. Searches may be negative and FDLE may not have records responsive to your public records request. You may also receive an invoice for your request depending on the nature and extent of your public records request. A copy of the FDLE Guide to Public Records is attached for your review.

Please feel free to contact us if you have additional specific information relating to the records you are requesting, as this may help expedite your request and/or reduce costs that may be associated with the request.

Additional information regarding how to obtain public records including what costs may be applicable may be found on our website http://www.fdle.state.fl.us/OGC/Public-Records.aspx.
We are committed to our fundamental values of Service, Integrity, Respect, and Quality.

If you have questions concerning your request, please contact us at (850) 410-7676 or publicrecords@fdle.state.fl.us<mailto:publicrecords@fdle.state.fl.us>, and please include your "PRR" docket number we've provided above

Sincerely,

Office of General Counsel
Florida Department of Law Enforcement
Post Office Box 1489
Tallahassee, FL 32302-1489

If you need criminal history records, please visit our website, https://www.fdle.state.fl.us/Criminal-History-Records/Obtaining-Criminal-History-Information.aspx, and/or contact FDLE’s Criminal History Services Section at ApplicantChecks@fdle.state.fl.us<mailto:ApplicantChecks@fdle.state.fl.us> or (850) 410-8161.

Public records requests are processed in the order that they are received. Processing time may be lengthened due to the nature and extent of the request. Searches may be negative and FDLE may not have records responsive to your public records request. You may also receive an invoice for your request depending on the nature and extent of your public records request. Please feel free to contact us at (850) 410-7676, or publicrecords@fdle.state.fl.us, if you have additional specific information relating to the records you are requesting, as this may help expedite your request and/or reduce costs that may be associated with the request.

Additional information regarding how to obtain public records including what costs may be applicable is contained from the hyperlink below. We are committed to our fundamental values of Service, Integrity, Respect, and Quality.

For Additional Information click http://www.fdle.state.fl.us/OGC/Public-Records.aspx<https://www.fdle.state.fl.us/OGC/Public-Records.aspx>

communications.subject: FW: Response to Public Records Request, FDLE Docket No. PRR-2022-1746
communications.communication:
Dear Jeff Collins:

RE:      Response to Public Records Request, FDLE Docket No. PRR-2022-1746
            Request 1.) A copy of all emails received by FDLE at email address: TARRequest@fdle.state.fl.us and/or DAVIDsupport@fdle.state.fl.us from any email address with a domain ending in the following: @sheriffleefl.org, @pascosheriff.org, @hcso.tampa.fl.us, @tampagov.net.
2.) A copy of all replies to the emails requested above, including any attachments.

Please find the attached records in response to your public records request. These records are provided pursuant to Florida's Public Records Law, Chapter 119, Florida Statutes. Portions exempt from public disclosure pursuant to the following have been removed:

s. 119.071(5)(a)5., F.S.          Social security numbers held by an agency are confidential and exempt from s. 119.07<http://www.leg.state.fl.us/Statutes/index.cfm?App_mode=Display_Statute&Search_String=&URL=0100-0199/0119/Sections/0119.07.html>(1) and s. 24(a), Art. I of the State Constitution.

ss. 119.0712(2)(a)-(b), F.S.    Personal information contained in a motor vehicle record including highly restricted personal information as defined in 18 U.S.C. s. 2725, contained in a motor vehicle record is confidential pursuant to the federal Driver's Privacy Protection Act of 1994, 18 U.S.C. ss. 2721 et seq.

Federal Driver's Privacy Protection Act of 1994, 18 U.S.C. ss. 2721 et seq (DPPA).

s. 119.071(4)(d)2.a.,F.S.        The home addresses, telephone numbers, dates of birth, and photographs of active or former sworn law enforcement personnel or of active or former civilian personnel employed by a law enforcement agency. The names, home addresses, telephone numbers, photographs, dates of birth, and places of employment of the spouses and children of such personnel; and the names and locations of schools and day care facilities attended by the children of such personnel are exempt from s. 119.07<http://www.leg.state.fl.us/Statutes/index.cfm?App_mode=Display_Statute&Search_String=&URL=0100-0199/0119/Sections/0119.07.html>(1) and s. 24(a), Art. I of the State Constitution.

Your public records request, PRR-2022-1746 is now closed.  If you have questions concerning your request, please contact us at (850) 410-7676 or PublicRecords@fdle.state.fl.us<mailto:PublicRecords@fdle.state.fl.us>.

Sincerely,

Office of General Counsel
Florida Department of Law Enforcement
Post Office Box 1489
Tallahassee, FL 32302-1489

CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE - The information contained in this e-mail transmission from the Florida Department of Law Enforcement is privileged and CONFIDENTIAL. It is intended for the sole use of the person (s) or entity named. If you are not the intended recipient of this transmission, the dissemination, distribution, copying, or other use of this information may constitute a violation of §119, F. S. and is strictly prohibited. If you have received this email in error, please contact the sender immediately.

title: District of Columbia Adut Pay to Stay Policy

communications.subject: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: District of Columbia Adut Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the DC Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following materials regarding the imposition, assessment, collection and balances of inmate fees and debt:

All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which inmates are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc). 

All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of individuals charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly Stevenson

communications.subject: FW: DC Freedom of Information Act Request: District of Columbia Adut Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

This is in response to your Freedom of Information Act request that was received on December 19, 2022 and assigned Tracking # 2022-12-19-2964F.

Please note that, under the policy of the DC Department of Corrections (DOC), Program Manual 6000.1l (Medical Management), DOC "inmates are not required to make medical co-payments...." You may obtain PM 6000.1l at https://doc.dc.gov/page/doc-program-statements. Note, also, that inmates do not incur "board costs or fees."

Further, no additional responsive DOC records were found.

If you consider this response a denial of your FOIA request, you are advised of your right under D.C. Official Code § 2-537 and 1 DCMR 412 to appeal to the Mayor or to the Superior Court of the District of Columbia.

If you elect to appeal to the Mayor, your appeal must be in writing and contain "Freedom of Information Act Appeal" or "FOIA Appeal" in the subject line of the letter as well as on the outside of the envelope.  The appeal must include (1) a copy of the original request, (2) a copy of this letter, (3) a statement of the circumstances, reasons, and or arguments advanced in support of disclosure, and (4) a daytime telephone number, and e-mail and/or U.S. Mail address at which you can be reached.  The appeal must be emailed to foia.appeals@dc.gov<mailto:foia.appeals@dc.gov> or mailed to the Mayor's Office of Legal Counsel (MOLC) at 1350 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Suite 407, Washington, D.C. 20004. Further, a copy of all appeal materials must be forwarded to me.

Failure to follow these administrative steps will result in delay in the processing and commencement of a response to your appeal to the Mayor.

Best,


Oluwasegun Obebe
Records, Information & Privacy Officer
DC Department of Corrections
Office of the General Counsel
2000 14th Street, NW, 7th Floor
Washington, DC 20009
(202) 671-2055 (O)
(202) 538-2389 (C)
(202) 671-1705 (F)
Segun.obebe@dc.gov<mailto:Segun.obebe@dc.gov>
www.doc.dc.gov<http://www.doc.dc.gov/>

title: Pennsylvania DOC Adult Pay to Stay Policy

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Pennsylvania DOC Adult Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which inmates are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc). 

2) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of individuals charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Elijah Salisbury

communications.subject: RE: [External] Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Pennsylvania DOC Adult Pay to Stay Policy/RTKL 1258-22
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Salisbury,

This email acknowledges receipt by the Department of Corrections (the Department) of your written request for records under the Pennsylvania Right-to-Know Law (RTKL).  Your request was received on December 21, 2022.

In accordance with the RTKL, you are hereby notified that, for the reason set forth below, the Department is extending the final response date of your request to January 27, 2023:


  *   A legal review is necessary to determine whether the record requested is subject to access under the Act.

At this time, the Department is unable to provide you with an estimated cost to fulfill your current request if it is granted.  Any actual or estimated fees will be identified in the Department's future response.

Sincerely,

Andrew Filkosky

Andrew Filkosky
Agency Open Records Officer

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Community Development Software
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All technical proposals, quotes, and executed contracts with the City's building permit software vendor, Brightly (also potentially d/b/a/ SmartGov or Dude Solutions in your records)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Lars Hansen

title: Automated License Plate Readers (Indio Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Automated License Plate Readers (Indio Police Department)
communications.communication:
Dear Custodian of Records:

This letter constitutes a request under the California Public Records Act ("CPRA") from the Electronic Frontier Foundation, submitted with the assistance of MuckRock News. 

We request the following records related to Automated License Plate Readers ("ALPRs") and your law enforcement agency ("Agency").

Part A - Information related to ALPR data sharing.

A1. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares ALPR data;
A2. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ALPR data;
A3. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares “hot list” information;
A4. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives “hot list” information.
The information requested in items A1-A4 is readily available for extraction through the ALPR software you use. For example, with Vigilant Solutions/Motorola Solutions, this data can be exported easily using the Data Sharing Report function. With Flock Safety, this information is available through the transparency portal function. Other software, such as BOSS, has similar functionality.  

Most agencies have encountered little difficulty in providing this information (see below). In a small number of cases, an agency has interpreted items A1-A4 as requesting the creation of a record that does not exist. We disagree: this data is maintained by your software, can be exported through software your agency has already purchased, and is therefore subject to CPRA. 

However, should you disagree, you may alternatively produce the following records:  

A5. All agreements, memoranda of understanding, requests, or other certifying documents that external agencies have signed to comply with Sec 1798.90.52(b) for accessing your agency's ALPR data. These documents are also often required under the "Releasing ALPR Data" subsection of a California law enforcement agency's SB 34 policy. 
A6. All agreements, memoranda of understanding, requests, or other certifying documents  that your agency has signed pursuant to Sec 1798.90.52(b) to access other agencies' ALPR data.
A7. All "records of access" required by Sec. 1798.90.52(a) for the periods January 1, 2021 until the date of processing this request. 

Items A5-A7 are not necessary if your agency provides the information requested in items A1-A4. We feel that items A1-A4 are more focused and would require less labor from your agency to produce. 

Part B - Information Related to Numbers of “Detections” (plate scans) and “Hits” (plate scans that matched to a hotlist)

B1. The aggregate number of "detections" collected during 2021.
B2.  The aggregate number of “hits” during 2021.
B3. The aggregate number of "detections" from January 1, 2022 until the date this request is processed. If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period. For example, most Flock Safety systems may not have this data beyond 30 days. 
B4.  The aggregate number of “hits” from January 1, 2022 until the date this request is processed. If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period.

The information requested in items B1-B4 is readily available through the ALPR software you use. For example, with Vigilant Solutions/Motorola Solutions, this data can be exported easily using the Hit Ratio Report function. With Flock Safety, this information  is available through the transparency portal function. Other software, such as BOSS, has similar functionality.  As noted above, this information exists within your system and can be easily exported with existing software.

Part C - Assistance, Description, and Recommendations. 

We make the following requests under section 6253.1 of the California Public Records Act

C1. A description of  the information technology and physical location in which the records exist.
C2. Assist us identifying records and information that will help the public understand how ALPR data and hotlists are shared, how much data is collected year-to-year, and how much of that data matches a hot list; and 
C3. Provide suggestions for overcoming any practical basis for denying access to the information sought.

Please note that more than 80 California law enforcement agencies have provided the information requested in Parts A1-A4 and B1-B4 in previous years. For your reference we have included a list below with the names of the agencies that have historically provided these records. 

American Canyon Police Department
Auburn Police Department
Bakersfield Police Department
Beaumont Police Department
Bell Gardens Police Department
Bell Police Department
Belvedere Police Department
Beverly Hills Police Department
Brawley Police Department
Brentwood Police Department
Buena Park Police Department
Burbank Police Department
Carlsbad Police Department
Cathedral City Police Department
Chino Police Department
Chula Vista Police Department
Citrus Heights Police Department
Claremont Police Department
Clayton Police Department
Contra Costa County Sheriff's Office
Coronado Police Department
CSU Fullerton Police Department
Cypress Police Department
El Segundo Police Department
Fairfield Police Department
Folsom Police Department
Fontana Police Department
Fresno Police Department
Fullerton Police Department
Galt Police Department
Garden Grove Police Department
Gardena Police Department
Glendale Police Department
Hemet Police Department
Hermosa Beach Police Department
Imperial Police Department
Irvine Police Department
La Habra Police Department
La Mesa Police Department
La Verne Police Department
Laguna Beach Police Department
Livermore Police Department
Lodi Police Department
Long Beach Police Department
Marin County Sheriff's Office
Martinez Police Department
Merced Police Department
Mill Valley Police Department
Modesto Police Department
Monterey Park Police Department
Newport Beach Police Department
Oakley Police Department
Orange County Sheriff's Office
Orange Police Department
Palm Springs Police Department
Palos Verdes Estates Police
Pasadena Police Department
Pleasant Hill Police Department
Pomona Police Department
Redlands Police Department
Redondo Beach Police Department
Ripon Police Department
Roseville Police Department
Salinas Police Department
San Bernardino County Sheriff's Office
San Diego County Sheriff's Office
San Diego Police Department
San Mateo County Sheriff's Office
Sausalito Police Department
Simi Valley Police Department
Stanislaus County Sheriff's Office
Stockton Police Department
Tiburon Police Department
Torrance Police Department
Tracy Police Department
Tustin Police Department
West Sacramento Police Department
Westminster Police Department
Woodland Police Department
Yolo County Sheriff's Office
(This URL links to a dataset with links to the records: https://www.eff.org/document/data-driven-2-california-dragnet-data-set ) 

CPRA requires you to undertake reasonable efforts to locate responsive records and to work in good faith with requesters to respond to their request. See CYAC v. City of National City, 220 Cal.App.4th 1385, 1430 (2013). Thus under the CPRA you are obligated to conduct a reasonable search and cannot deny a request merely because it might generate a large volume of records. 

We ask that you please respond to this request within 10 days either by providing all the requested records or by providing a written response setting forth the legal authority on which you rely in withholding or redacting any document, as well as stating when documents will be made available. Should you choose to withhold or reject this request, we ask that you provide an explanation of why your agency is responding differently compared to the many others that have complied with our request. 

We also request that any records maintained in an electronic format be provided in that same format (such as a PDF, CSV or XLS file), to avoid copying costs.

However, should you be unable to do so, EFF will reimburse you for the direct costs of copying these records (if you elect to charge for copying) plus postage. If you anticipate that these costs will exceed $25.00, or that the time needed to copy the records will delay their release, please contact me so that I can arrange to inspect the documents or decide which documents I wish to have copied. Please also provide an invoice and a cost breakdown of the fee estimate. If the fees are less than $25.00, please copy and send the records and invoice as soon as possible, and we will promptly pay the required costs.

Thank you for your consideration of this request. If you have any questions or concerns, or if I can provide any clarification that will help identify responsive documents or focus this request, please do not hesitate to contact me at (415) 436-9333 x151 or dm@eff.org. You may also mail correspondence to the Electronic Frontier Foundation, 815 Eddy. St. San Francisco, CA, 94109.
                                               
Sincerely,
 
 
Dave Maass
Director of Investigations
Electronic Frontier Foundation

Dropbox Passwords is the solution  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌       Never forget your password again Dropbox Passwords lets you seamlessly login to websites and apps by storing your passwords and syncing them with all your devices. And it’s included with your current plan, free!   Save your passwords[1]          Protect yourself
from online threats 1 in 10 Americans are victims of identity fraud each year[2], but you don’t have to be one of them. If you’re ordering something, sharing photos, or storing important documents, learn how to protect your data. Get protected[3]         Learn how others use
Dropbox Passwords Ready to make the most of Dropbox Passwords? You’re in good company. Connect with the Community to get tips and tricks from other Dropboxers like you. Join the community[4]        Digitize signatures  Did you know documents signed electronically are just as legal as those signed with a pen? Learn how Dropbox Sign can save you time without compromise.    Find out how[5]

communications.subject: Check out what you get with your plan
communications.communication:
Dropbox has features just for you  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌      Discover all the powerful tools in your account Connect with team members and clients in innovative and time-saving ways, execute legally binding eSignatures, consolidate video feedback, send large files, and so much more. Learn how Dropbox is working hard to make your work less complicated.    Stay in the know         Share and make it interesting (and fast)  Use Dropbox Capture to create screen recordings with GIFs, screenshots, voiceovers, and markups to help you say more in less time. BONUS: Get extra minutes of recording time when you refer new Capture users!
   Start capturing            Make it official with eSignatures  Have leases, tax forms, onboarding paperwork, or any other documents that need signing? Dropbox lets you securely send, sign, and store documents directly from your account.
   Start eSigning            Get to final_final faster  Skip the endless email chains and back-and-forth feedback loops. Dropbox Replay makes it easy to consolidate comments, take action on feedback, and finalize your video and audio projects. Also, commenters don’t even need a Dropbox account. 
   Learn how to Replay            Need to send files securely and efficiently  Final delivery shouldn’t be a hassle. Use Dropbox Transfer to easily and securely send large files or collections of files. You can track downloads, control file access, and prevent unwanted edits to your original files. It only takes a couple clicks.
   Start transferring            If any of this sounds like it can help make your life a little easier, take a minute to compare our different offerings.   Compare Dropbox products

 Dropbox, Inc.

communications.subject: There’s a plan for everyone
communications.communication:
Learn which Dropbox plan is for you  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌      The perfect plan? 
 It was here all along Whether you are uploading content to the cloud, sharing photos with family, building a business, or managing a team, Dropbox has a plan to keep your life moving forward.    Find my plan         Dropbox Plus: More of the good stuff  Deleting old photos and videos to make room for new ones isn't the solution. Instead, get the space you need to keep all of your files stored securely in one organized place that you can access anytime, anywhere.
   Try Plus for free            Dropbox Family: Together we can do more  Tired of being the family’s tech support? Skip the back and forth and come together with 2,000 GB (that’s about 500,000 photos) of shared cloud storage. While everyone gets their own account for photos, passwords, and docs, the Family Room is where you can share anything from pictures and recipes to medical records and copies of your new lease.
   Get on the Family plan            Dropbox Pro: Because you mean business  Running a small business can pull you in every direction. Get the tools you need to put all the pieces together—without leaving Dropbox. From large file transfers and custom branding to eSignatures and watermarking, Dropbox Pro has what you need to always deliver your best work.
   Start your free trial            Dropbox Teams: Optimize your workflow  Does it feel like you spend more time switching between programs than actually being focused? Bring everything you need to work together in one place. Get more done in less time when your team is connected and can access all the tools and content in Dropbox.
   Get started            If any of this sounds like it can help make your life a little easier, take a minute to compare our different offerings.   Compare Dropbox products      

____________________________________________________
 Dropbox, Inc. 
 PO Box 77767, San Francisco, CA 94107

communications.subject: Erika Martinez shared "Batch 2 REDACTED" with you
communications.communication:
Hi Dave,

Erika Martinez (emartinez@indiopd.org) invited you to edit the folder " Batch 2 REDACTED " on Dropbox.

Erika said:
"Dear requester,

Please find attached Batch 2 of our agency's responsive records. Our agency has made allowable redactions under the California Public Records Act Section 6250 et al.  This concludes our agency's response to your PRA request.

Thank you.

Erika Martinez"

Go to folder[1]

Enjoy!
The Dropbox team

[1]: https://www.dropbox.com/l/scl/AACicxFzix_1CtfTBouwmcNB2BhKdPGgiMI

title: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: ShotSpotter Contract (Camden Police Department)

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: ShotSpotter Contract (Camden Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the current contract between this department, the city, and ShotSpotter, Inc. This request includes the full ShotSpotter Services Agreement, Standard Terms and Conditions, terms of service (including square miles covered, total cost, and contract beginning and end dates), any reference service level agreements, contract amendments, cure notices, non-disclosure agreements, or other revisions to agreements.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

The Just Data Lab

communications.subject: Welcome to the Camden County Open Public Records Center
communications.communication:
Dear The Just Data Lab, 
Thank you for registering with the Camden County Open Public Records Center.  Please log in to the Records Center to update any contact or password information and to track the progress of your request. 
 Login: 137407-69273936@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: 
 
Request Temporary Password here. (https://camdencountynj.mycusthelp.com/webapp/_rs/ForgotPassword.aspx) 
 
 
 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.subject: Open Public Records Act Request :: W023053-113022
communications.communication:
Maria Efstratiades  
 
 Custodian of Records  Telephone: (856) 225 – 2131 
 Camden County Administration   
 520 Market Street, 11th Floor 
 Camden, NJ 08102-1375 
Dear The Just Data Lab: 
 
Thank you for submitting an Open Public Records request with Camden County.   Your request was given the reference number W023053-113022 for tracking purposes. 
 
 
Our office will forward your request to the appropriate Department for their review and search of their files for the requested records.   A written response will be send to you within seven business days or sooner depending on the type of records requested. 
 
 
Please note that day one of the calculation begins the day after the custodian receives your OPRA request.  This calculation applies to the agency’s actual business days of operations which are 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.  If the agency is closed for a holiday, this date does not count towards the seven business day deadline.  If any request received after the close of a business day will be deemed received on the next business day. 
 
You may monitor the progress of your request at the link below.  Additionally, you will receive an email from our office to inform you that your request has been completed and a response is posted at the below link. 
 
Again, thank you for using the Open Public Records Center. 
 
 
Open Public Records Center - http://www.camdencounty.com/open-public-records-opra/ 
 
Maria Efstratiades 
Custodian of Records

communications.subject: Open Records Request :: W023053-113022
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

   
 Maria Efstratiades  
 Custodian of Records  Telephone: (856) 225 – 2131 
 Camden County Administration   
 520 Market Street, 11th Floor 
 Camden, NJ 08102-1375 
 
Please DO NOT REPLY to this email. This mailbox is not monitored and you will not receive a response. FOR FURTHER CORRESPONDENCE PLEASE send an email to opra.custodian@camdencounty.com or GENERATE A NEW REQUEST THROUGH THE OPEN RECORDS CENTER. (mailto:opracustodian@camdencounty.com) 
11/30/2022 
The Just Data Lab 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR137407 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston, MA 02115 
RE: OPRA REQUEST of 11/30/2022, Reference # W023053-113022 
Dear The Just Data Lab, 
The Camden County Custodian of Records received your Open Public Records Act request on 11/30/2022. To access your request and retrieve your records please click here. 
The Camden County Office of County Counsel conducted a search of their files and provided records responsive to your request. The Purchase Orders provided act as the contracts for the records you requested. No other records exist. 

Additionally,  the Camden County Custodian of Records does not have access to Camden City records. You may contact Camden City to request records pertaining to "A copy of the current contract between... the city, and ShotSpotter, Inc.". 

As such, this correspondence and the records provided constitutes completion of your request. 
Pursuant to N.J.S.A. 47:1A-1, et seq. if your request for access to a government record has been denied or unfilled within the seven (7) business days required by law, you have a right to challenge the decision by the County of Camden to deny access.  As provided by law, you have the right to either institute a proceeding in the Superior Court of New Jersey or file a complaint with the Government Records Council (GRC) by completing their Denial of Access Complaint Form located at the GRC’s website at www.state.nj.us/grc. (www.state.nj.us/grc) 
You may contact the GRC by toll-free telephone at 866-850-0511, by mail at P.O. Box 819, Trenton, NJ, 08625, by e-mail at grc@dca.state.nj.us. The GRC can also answer other questions about the law. All questions regarding complaints filed in Superior Court should be directed to the Superior Court. (mailto:grc@dca.state.nj.us) 
Should you have any questions, please contact the Custodian of Records at (856) 225-2131. 
Sincerely, 
Steffani Lon for 
Maria Efstratiades Maria Efstratiades 
Custodian of Records 
Camden County 
Office of Archives & Records Management 
Courthouse, 11th Floor 
520 Market Street 
Camden, NJ 08102-1375 
Phone: (856) 225-2131 
E-mail: opra.custodian@camdencounty.com (mailto:opracustodian@camdencounty.com) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY. FOR FURTHER CORRESPONDENCE PLEASE GENERATE A NEW REQUEST THROUGH THE OPEN RECORDS CENTER.

communications.subject: RE: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request #W023053-113022
communications.communication:
Hello Maria,


Thank you so much for your prompt attention to this request. Upon logging into your agency's website that was linked in the email, we were unable to view any related documents in association with this request. The purchase records indicated in the correspondence could not be located. Please advise.


Thank You,

MuckRock Staff

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: PWBC Tri-County FOIA Project: Residential Water Data (Clerk)
communications.communication:
Dear Records Custodian,

This is a request under the Michigan Freedom of Information Act (MCL 15.231 et. seq.) for documents that detail how your community’s water system functions, including details on utility terminations, restorations, and rates.

As context for this request, I am requesting these records on behalf of the People’s Water Board Coalition, a non-profit organization that advocates for equitable access, protection, and affordability of utility services, and water conservation. We are filing similar requests for information with many other Michigan water utilities in collaboration with residents, community leaders, and local officials to better support the needs of low-income customers. If any of this information is publicly available and accessible, please send a link to the webpage where it is located. Please reply to this request via email. If you have any question or concern about this request, please call Cass Charrette at 248-980-1191.

When possible, please provide the requested quantitative data in an Excel spreadsheet or other native digital format (such as CSV files). 

1. A copy of any data and documents that list the addresses and dates of residential customers that have had their water service terminated starting January 1, 2019 to date of the submission of the FOIA, the reason for the termination, and the amount of arrears for each account. If this data is produced in another format, such as written logs or summary reports, please provide a copy of that instead. If your agency has a policy that home address information is exempt from FOIA, please provide this data at the street level. 

2. Any documents describing and listing the addresses and dates of residential customers that have had their water service restored starting January 1, 2019 to date of submission of the FOIA, following a disconnection. If this data is included in the same data set as Item 6, you may provide that full data set in lieu of processing this element separately.

3. A copy of any existing, regularly generated reports that include the total amount of water and wastewater customer arrearages, number of customers in arrears, and median amount of arrearages per customer, and number of customers subject to potential service disconnection due to arrears by customer class (e.g., residential, non-profit, commercial, industrial) starting January 1, 2019 to date of submission of the FOIA. 

4. A copy of a list of referrals the utility/water system/municipality sent to the tax assessor to place a tax lien on properties due to non-payment of any water or sewer bill, starting January 1, 2019 to date of submission of the FOIA, and the amount of arrears for each account. If this information is stored in a summary database, you may provide that database.

5. Any documents describing or listing the addresses of residential customer accounts that have been enrolled in and have been discharged from the Great Lakes Water Authority’s Water Residential Assistance Program, and the reason for such removal or discharge, starting January 1, 2019 to date of submission of the FOIA. 

As I am requesting these records as a representative of People’s Water Board Coalition, a non-profit organization, and am doing so in the public interest, I request a waiver of fees. The analysis and release of these materials will contribute significantly to public understanding of water affordability issues in the tri-county area. 

I will expect a response within 5 business days as provided by law. If my request is denied in whole or in part, I expect a detailed justification for withholding the records. I also request any segregable portions that are not exempt to be disclosed.

If you have any questions or suggestions for reducing the burden of my request, please reach out and we are happy to discuss.

Sincerely,
People’s Water Board Coalition

Please see the attached document regarding FOIA Request #22-056 that was submitted to the City of Lincoln Park. A waiver of fees was requested. Page 6, section 6, of the City of Lincoln Park FOIA Procedures and Guidelines<https://cms6.revize.com/revize/lincolnparkmi/document_center/Learn%20About/FOIA_Policies_and_Guidelines.pdf> states: "Section 6: Waiver of Fees The cost of the search for and copying of a public record may be waived or reduced if in the sole judgment of the FOIA Coordinator a waiver or reduced fee is in the public interest because it can be considered as primarily benefitting the general public. The City of Lincoln Park may identify specific records or types of records it deems should be made available for no charge or at a reduced cost."
